Name: sodium cyanide production | sodium cyanide | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description: Production from sodium hydroxide and hydrogen cyanide by neutralization, the efficiency of which is very high (if the raw materials are sufficiently pure (Kirk, 2004)), attaining a yield >99%, and only minimal losses occur (Ulmann, 2004).;Reaction:;HCN + NaOH → NaCN + H2O, ΔH = 460 kJ;Modern commercial facilities use purified anhydrous liquid hydrogen cyanide as raw material, that reacts with a 50% solution of sodium hydroxide. Furthermore, high capacity plants generate high purity sodium cyanide via evaporation of water and crystallization (Kirk, 2004). A crucial aspect is the system's control to maximize the sodium formate formation by avoiding the hydrogen cyanide polymer formation.;In this dataset, a yield of 99% was assumed, as per the literature mentioned above.;References:;Kirk, Raymond E., Donald F. Othmer, and Charles A. Mann. "Encyclopedia of Chemical Technology." 2004.;Ullmann's encyclopedia of industrial chemistry (2004).
